question: Give me all the metrics from Table 1 that are in category 'Discussion and Analysis' for Apparel, Accessories & Footwear, Appliance Manufacturing, and Building Products & Furnishings industries.
reference_text: CG-AA-440a.1. Description of environmental and social risks associated with sourcing priority raw materials
CG-AM-410a.3. Description of efforts to manage products' end-of-life impacts
CG-BF-410a.1. Description of efforts to manage product lifecycle impacts and meet demand for sustainable products
pairing_explanation: These industries all involve consumer goods that have significant global supply chains, environmental impacts from manufacturing, and considerations around labor practices in emerging markets.

question: Which industry has more 'Quantitative' metrics to disclose in Table 1 between Appliance Manufacturing and Building Products & Furnishings industries?
optionA: Appliance Manufacturing has more quantitative metrics in Table 1.
optionB: Building Products & Furnishings has more quantitative metrics in Table 1.
optionC: Both industries have an equal number of quantitative metrics in Table 1.
optionD: Neither industry has any quantitative metrics listed in Table 1.
optionE: The information to determine this is not provided in the document.
reference_text: For Appliance Manufacturing, Table 1 shows 2 quantitative metrics: CG-AM-410a.1, CG-AM-410a.2
For Building Products & Furnishings, Table 1 shows 3 quantitative metrics: CG-BF-130a.1, CG-BF-410a.2, CG-BF-430a.1
pairing_explanation: These industries all involve consumer goods that have significant global supply chains, environmental impacts from manufacturing, and considerations around labor practices in emerging markets.

question: Are there any common sustainability topics between Apparel, Accessories & Footwear, Appliance Manufacturing, and Building Products & Furnishings industries?
optionA: No, there are no common sustainability topics across the three industries.
optionB: Yes, the common sustainability topic is Raw Materials Sourcing.
optionC: Yes, the common sustainability topic is Product Lifecycle Environmental Impacts.
optionD: Yes, the common sustainability topics are Raw Materials Sourcing and Product Lifecycle Environmental Impacts.
optionE: Yes, the common sustainability topic is Energy Management in Manufacturing.
reference_text: Topics for Apparel, Accessories & Footwear include Raw Materials Sourcing
Topics for Appliance Manufacturing include Product Lifecycle Environmental Impacts
Topics for Building Products & Furnishings include Product Lifecycle Environmental Impacts
pairing_explanation: These industries all involve consumer goods that have significant global supply chains, environmental impacts from manufacturing, and considerations around labor practices in emerging markets.
